title: SmokerApeth
author: SmokerApeth
content: Hello everyone! This is my first visit to Bitcoin Talk and I am writing a post.I wonder what you think about my NFT.Please evaluate me coldly! I think your advice will help me grow up! I will attach the link where my nft work is registered at the bottom....https://opensea.io/collection/smokerapethIf it's a problem, I'll delete the post right away.

comments.author: Yogee
comments.body: When did you start making these collections? These kinds of artworks are not really my thing so I'm not the right person to give feedback. One thing I could say is that you could have sold a lot these during the last bullrun. Maybe keep creating and see if you could make improvements until the next bitcoin halving.Quote from: SmokerApeth on January 16, 2023, 03:20:07 PMIf it's a problem, I'll delete the post right away.You're good.

comments.author: o48o
comments.body: Quote from: SmokerApeth on January 16, 2023, 03:20:07 PM,-cut-I wonder what you think about my NFT.-cut-Sadly i get the feeling of copy of the copy of the copy. Adding a cigarette to some nft collection that already exist doesn't really signal any effort or that you are being serious and had big plans for this. ( i am assuming that you took the apes from somewhere and modified as there are ton of these pixelated punks and apes, if you didn't please do correct me.)Â At least you aren't using midjourney so i am giving points for that, AI art is currently lowest effort of them all and for some reason EVERYONE wants to try it and flood the markets with it..

comments.author: livingfree
comments.body: Welcome to bitcointalk, Smoker Apeth!IMHO, your NFT is like a copycat of the cypherpunk NFTs. Yeah, you've added a cigarette and the image changes but I don't see originality with it, nice try though as you're wanting to improve so you asked the communities thought about it.Well, keep on improving and despite the NFT arts are no longer on hype but having the talent of making art images, you've got a lot way to go but be unique.

comments.author: Wexnident
comments.body: It has the feeling of the usual NFT people buy, question is, can you hype it big enough to sell it? Cause NFTs that have styles like these are mostly just hyped-up projects, without any marketing strategies I doubt you'd be able to sell much at all. I'd honestly spend a year or two developing a personal style instead and then creating an NFT project, maybe even accepting commissions (since no one really buys NFTs for how "good" the art is). IF you're continuing on to the NFT path, I don't think you need to copy how most NFTs do the "Base NFT + some flavor" style, make your own unique ones. It doesn't matter if the quantity is small, quality over quantity at the start imo. Quantity will come sooner or later with you continuing to develop your skills.

comments.author: Supianto
comments.body: These NFTs look like avatars for some old online games. Can't say that is a bad thing, it's just not for me. But the starting price is good for a newbie and collection itself. Good luck with that.

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: 0.09 ETH for this? Why? Where did that price come from, given that only one person owns the collection? In my opinion, you have inflated the price too much. Such NFTs won't be in demand simply because this collection isn't known, it isn't supported by anyone, and it doesn't have any active community. There's a 99% chance this collection will die after a while, just like many others like it.

comments.author: ryzaadit
comments.body: The trend is over.People already make a shitty comment on these type NFTs in the internet, you are a little bit late to the party. If you created at that time people are still stupid putting their money into NFTs (this one could be work).But at this time, are not gonna to work. Trend over & people already realized losing their money (without a chance to be cashout because order book are really hard to find).

comments.author: Cvetik56
comments.body: You're definitely too late with that. The NFT market is not really pumping and hyped right now, without marketing you won't be able to make any money from it. Just as if anyone will buy your NFT, which I really doubt.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: One thing definitely will create great floor price is the demand and hype on your project. Nothing wrongs with such arts or design as long as its utility has been preserved. I dont know but many has seen the effect of it during the bull run and we will see fake or useless one died out of the process.If the environment how nft works change then maybe it will return to a healthy nft market.

comments.author: $crypto$
comments.body: Quote from: Xal0lex on January 17, 2023, 05:10:21 PM0.09 ETH for this? Why? Where did that price come from, given that only one person owns the collection? In my opinion, you have inflated the price too much. Such NFTs won't be in demand simply because this collection isn't known, it isn't supported by anyone, and it doesn't have any active community. There's a 99% chance this collection will die after a while, just like many others like it.If there is no active community and without the support of anyone behind it then investors will not buy it, this will be in vain at a high price but I will not belittle other people's work it's just that the hype in NFT is over because there have been many losses investing in NFT.This collection wouldn't be worth much to sell unless he himself collected it as a maker, but the OP was inspired by@BoredApeYC and @cryptopunksnfts I read on his twitter.

comments.author: Kelvinid
comments.body: Having NFTs and creating them become a problem if it has no sustainable market to support them. As I can see, the majority of NFT projects are worthless that is why only a few investors have the courage to collect them. If we are aiming to earn money from having this stuff, this can be difficult, this can be just considered as a market collection in the end. Honestly, it was not a profitable investment by now as their time has been over.

comments.author: ultrloa
comments.body: NFT project will not be successful if there's no community build up to support this project so if you want to get hype or people to support this art much better first if you invest on marketing to invite those collectors to participate or bought what you create. But now this is hard due to scams happen in this space and seems NFT is now slowly fading out since I don't see people talking about this recently.

comments.author: NFTmetria
comments.body: It's nice to see a lot of NFT collections being developed.In my opinion, your collection does not stand out from hundreds of other collections, and judging by the sales volume, others think so.On the face of it, artists and collectors enter the NFT market thinking that as soon as they create a collection, a "full sale" is guaranteed. In 2023, this is no longer the case.In my opinion, you need to think about the development of your community, because. Only with a developed NFT community do collections have a chance of being sold out. You made a big mistake by not gaining loyal fans before the release. Your collection is completely missing any unique, personal idea. The idea that the collection conveys has a strong influence on the value of the collections. Try to create a bounty campaign to attract users and get advertising and social media coverage.You have decided to upload your collection and promote it on OpenSea without maintaining pages on social networks. This is a big mistake. OpenSea algorithms can push you to the top of the main page if you have significant activity in social networks.We have described the most common tips for promoting NFT collections in the article: How to promote an NFT collection.If my advice helped you, you can send your NFT to our official wallet as a thank you, in addition, those who visit our profile will see your NFT.

comments.author: Yatsan
comments.body: The design is quite good but with my personal opinion, connecting artworks to 'ape' which is a successful project in the first place. It would still be better to create another concept to introduce yourself as someone 'new' than to have an image of a copy artist in this industry. Well, indeed it could share a hype with the original project but still, things won't be the same if it is outcome you are hoping for. Use your imagination and capability as an artist. Would be much better to also express yourself and create your own 'self' in this industry and outside. NFTs are really hard in terms of choosing which is which. Demand based as well but originality and concept would be factors to determine a project's outcome.
